sentence.text: We noted that Sirtuin 1 (negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II) is overexpressed in HPV-infected cervical cancer cells and hypothesized that SIRT1 counteracts antiviral immunity.

entity.text: negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II

sentence.text: Here, we found that cervical cancer cells undergo massive death by negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II knockdown, but this effect is reversed by SIRT1 restoration.

entity.text: negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II

sentence.text: Interestingly, pyroptotic death signaling in negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II-knocked-down cells was transmitted to naÃ¯ve cervical cancer cells, which was mediated by extracellular vesicles carrying activation of innate immune response inflammasome proteins.

entity.text: negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II

sentence.text: Furthermore, the growth of cervical cancer xenografts was significantly inhibited by either negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II-targeting siRNAs or SIRT1-knockdown-derived extracellular vesicles.

entity.text: negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II

sentence.text: Immunohistochemical analyses showed that negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II expression correlated with poor clinical outcomes in cervical cancer.

entity.text: negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II

sentence.text: In conclusion, negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II enabled HPV-infected cervical cancer cells to continue growing by nullifying activation of innate immune response inflammasome-mediated immunity.

entity.text: negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II

sentence.text: Without negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II, cervical cancer cells could no longer survive because of the derepression of the activation of innate immune response inflammasome.

entity.text: negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II
